relatedanime.anime: Sword Gai: The Animation Part II

anime.description: A woman died a suspicious death in the forest. Beside her, the sword-smith http://anidb.net/ch94216 [Amon] finds a new-born boy with a tragic fate and takes him in. About 10 years later, this boy who is named http://anidb.net/ch94217 [Gai] and who has become Amon`s apprentice, loses his right arm in an accident while making a sword. Amon decides to take a sword called "Shiryuu", which is a sword with demonic powers that has been passed down for generations, and fashion it into an artificial arm for Gai. That was the beginning of it all... The story of this boy, who has become one with a demonic weapon and is drawn into a cruel fate in which he must face countless battles, can be seen as either the story of "a beautiful weapon and an ugly person" or of "the cruelty of weapons and the beauty of humans". This is a completely new world of comic noir. Source: mangaupdates.com

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

character.name: Arnys
character.description: A Busoma on Grimm`s side. She has the most beautiful hair in the world. The enemy of Issei. Source: Official page

character.name: Grimms
character.description: The strongest Busoma. He predicts human extinction. Source: Official page

character.name: Marcus Lithos
character.description: A boy who becomes paralyzed after being involved in an accident. Source: Official page

character.name: Ichijou Seiya
character.description: The most powerful Chrysalis at Syoshidai, a mysterious organization. He treats Gai as if he were his younger brother. Source: Official page

character.name: Miki Naoki
character.description: An agent and Chrysalis of Shoshidai. Source: Official page

character.name: Miura Takuma
character.description: Former administrator of Shoshidai. Father of Kyouka. Source: Official page

character.name: Ariga Issei
character.description: A charismatic beautician. His sister was killed by Arnys in the past. He turns into a Busoma by Arnys. Source: Official page

character.name: Tanaka Yasuko
character.description: Discovers Throlla`s treasure, which is worth a budget of a country. She fears nothing when it comes to getting Issei`s attention. Source: Official page

character.name: Matoba Kazuma
character.description: President of Matoba Group, a major enterprise. Source: Official page

character.name: Midoriko
character.description: An underground idol who is the champion of "The Sword Souls Game" video game. She joins Grimm`s side after possessing Flamberge. Source: Official page

character.name: Ogata Sayaka
character.description: Gai`s childhood friend. She supports Gai like a mother ever since they have known each other. Source: Official page

character.name: Ogata Amon
character.description: A swordsmith and adoptive father of Gai. Sayaka`s father. He gives Shiryu to Gai as a prosthesis after he loses his right arm. Source: Official page

character.name: Ogata Gai
character.description: Brought up by his adoptive father Amon, Gai sets his goal as becoming a swordsmith. He loses his right arm in an accident and replaces it with a prosthesis which is made from Shiryu, a legendary Japanese sword. Source: Official page

character.name: Kagami Kyouka
character.description: Administrator of Shoshidai. She decides when a Chrysalises, the agents of Shoshidai, needs to leave. Source: Official page

episode.title: Episode 12
episode.summary: Shoshidai`s new weapons are no match against the demonic powers of Zsoltgewinn, pitting Ichijo and Gai against Miura in a fierce battle. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 11
episode.summary: After Gai is safely brought to Shoshidai headquarters, Ichijo is ordered by Kagami to cold sleep due to his rapidly progressing change into a Busoma. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 10
episode.summary: A depressed Sayaka questions Amon about Gai`s motives. Meanwhile, Ichijo reveals to Gai how he came to harness the power of the Chakram. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 9
episode.summary: Miki and Marcus are sent on a covert mission by the Shoshidai to infiltrate and retrieve an ancient weapon of the fairy world: the legendary Halbert. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 8
episode.summary: A wealthy widow hires a search vessel to find the lost treasure of pirate Throlla, who reportedly also kept a mythical weapon known as Gallon`s Hammer. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 7
episode.summary: With Gai in tow, Ichijo heads to Shoshidai headquarters before stopping to meet his lover, Kei. A mysterious sword appears before gamer Midoriko. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 6
episode.summary: Ichijo attempts to test Gai`s potential as a Chrysalis but is interrupted by a member of the Gabi, a group that has long fought Busoma. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 5
episode.summary: The Shoshidai reawaken their most powerful Chrysalis, Seiya Ichijo. After Gai`s powers partially awaken, his mind reverts to that of an infant. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 4
episode.summary: With his soul possessed by a demonic spear, Tatsumi transforms into a monstrous entity called a Busoma. Miki takes Marcus to Shoshidai headquarters. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 3
episode.summary: After acquiring the Azoth Sword, Miki is ambushed by Marcus and Miura. Amon forges a prosthetic arm out of the sword Shiryu to replace Gai`s lost limb. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 2
episode.summary: An abandoned baby boy is adopted and named Gai by swordsmith Amon. He becomes an apprentice, later losing his arm in a ritual gone horribly wrong. Source: netflix

episode.title: Episode 1
episode.summary: Shoshidai, an organization tasked with collecting cursed weaponry, dispatches two of its agents to retrieve the legendary Demon Sword Zsoltgewinn. Source: netflix
